pandae667 wrote:
> I'd even like to help with that feature, but I have no clue where it
> would have to fit into the Heritrix architecture so far.
Start by looking at FetchHTTP: 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/fetcher/FetchHTTP.html.  
You might add an option in the constructor that says always solicit 
gzip'd response.  In the FetchHTTP context you'll figure whether the 
server has actually sent gzipped content going by its response -- see 
around line 397 -- and then, the tricky part, you'll need to gunzip 
whats been recorded to disk after the download has completed just before 
you leave the innerProcess method around line 485 (See HttpRecord -- 
it'll give you access to the download).

Let us know if we can help,
Thanks,
St.Ack
